pageTitle: WOODBERRY POETRY ROOM: Open to Visiting Researchers Upon Request | docomomo united states

textAfterTable: Tweets by @docomomo_us WOODBERRY POETRY ROOM: Open to Visiting Researchers Upon Request Published by info on Tue, 2006-10-10 13:13 Lamont Library has informed DOCOMOMO US that the Woodberry Poetry Room can be visited by researchers upon request: 9/25/2006 I was reading about the Woodberry Poetry Room controversy, and I noticed you said the room was not open to the public. While Lamont Library is not open to the public, outside researchers may use the Poetry Room, though they should contact the curator, Don Share, share@fas.harvard.edu, first. Colleen Bryant Lamont Library Reference Harvard College bryant4@fas.harvard.edu DOCOMOMO US notes that more information can be found here and that visitors should be aware that photography within Lamont is not allowed without the permission from the Office of the Librarian of Harvard College. See their website for policies. Email this page Printer-friendly version
